message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.NE, cs.DC 

This paper is about improving learning performance in deep reinforcement learning (DRL) through the arrangement of learning agents in communication networks. This topic falls under the category of machine learning, specifically reinforcement learning, which is covered by cs.LG. The paper also draws upon results from the networked optimization literature, which suggests that communication topologies can improve learning, making cs.AI and cs.SI likely sub-categories as well. Additionally, the paper explores the relative performance of different families of graphs, which could fall under cs.NE (neural and evolutionary computing) or cs.DC (distributed, parallel, and cluster computing).
